intro: Ophiorrhiza zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambal orchid vine, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and unique floral structures. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. Ophiorrhiza zambalensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical research.
